qas.question: What event caused major changes in Bermuda?
Why did defence infrastructure become the major source of Bermuda's economy?

answers.text: buildup of Naval and military forces in Bermuda,

qas.question: How does the British crown view Bermuda?

answers.text: a base more than a colony

qas.question: What happened to Bermuda's independance due to British importance on them for military reasons?

answers.text: the colony's independence on the world stage was diminished

qas.question: What colony caused profound change to the end of the war?
What infrastructure was built up in the 19th century?
What did Bermuda consider London to be more than a colony?

context: The <a0_0>end of the war<a0_0/>, however, was to cause profound change in <b4_0>Bermuda,<b4_0/> though some of those changes would take decades to crystallise. Following the war, with the <a1_0>buildup of Naval and military forces in Bermuda,<a1_0/> the primary leg of the Bermudian economy became <b5_0>defence<b5_0/> infrastructure. Even after tourism began later in the 19th century, Bermuda remained, in the eyes of London, <a2_0><b6_0>a base<b6_0/> more than a colony<a2_0/>. The Crown strengthened its political and economic ties to Bermuda, and <a3_0>the colony's independence on the world stage was diminished<a3_0/>.
